title: Umi to dokuyaku AKA The Sea and Poison (1986)
description:
Based on a novel by Shusaku Endo, Kei Kumai's THE SEA AND POISON tries to imagine the circumstances around the real-life war atrocities that occurred at Kyushu University. There, in 1945, Japanese doctors performed vivisections on downed American fliers. Shot in startlingly vivid black and white, THE SEA AND POISON shows how these events were not motivated by some supreme evil, but by mere pettiness, fear, and our most callow human emotions.
